column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=My earlier experience was ...
#Text=I worked for 15 years with the Royal Bank of Canada ending my banking career as a Branch Administration Officer .
#Text=This was great training in financial management , administration and supervision .
#Text=I have , together with my husband , built the small business which has supported our family for the past 20 years .
#Text=I am very aware of the challenges which face small businesses .
#Text=There are many small businesses in York Simcoe that would benefit from my experience and understanding of the challenges they face .
#Text=I volunteered for about 11 years with a local distress centre , life is very difficult for some of our constituents in York Simcoe .
#Text=When people are in times of crisis it is important that programs are in place to help them to get to the highest quality of life they can achieve .
#Text=I also served on the local executive and the national executive which was great use of my administrative skills .
#Text=I served as foster parent to young offenders for 7 years which gave me opportunity to work with many troubled youth .
#Text=I am aware of the challenges young people face as they grow up and also the need for strong , intact families to support them through those volatile years .
#Text=I have been a member of Speak for Success York Simcoe Toastmasters since 2004 .
#Text=I have served as Secretary , Vice President Education and President , which has further developed both my communication and leadership abilities .
#Text=I have served as District Secretary for District 61 and Secretary of Northern Lights Advanced Toastmaster Club .
#Text=I am currently serving as Club Coach to Simcoe Shores Toastmasters in Keswick .
#Text=I would use the experience garnered in all of these roles as Member of Parliament because the type of government I envision would be strong on leadership and accountability .
#Text=As you campaign around your riding , it 's likely that some issues are mentioned more often by voters , than other issues .
#Text=What would you say are the three hottest topics this election , in your riding ?
#Text=What would you and your party do to address these issues ?
#Text=Constituents in York Simcoe spend a lot of time travelling to and from work .
#Text=Gas prices are high and the other political parties offer no real solutions .
#Text=We offer a " Fair Tax " .
#Text=This would be a tax on everything except essentials .
#Text=Gas prices would be lower because there would not be layer upon layer of hidden taxes .
#Text=We would also eliminate the income tax because it penalises industrious people for working .
#Text=If 1/3 of your paycheque , what you have earned by your own labour , goes to the government before you see it , that is theft .
#Text=A consumer tax would be paid when you purchase items or services , which means you control how much tax you pay .
#Text=It is a much simpler form of book keeping .
#Text=Our present tax laws are understood by extremely few people .
#Text=Important to constituents of York
#Text=Simcoe is also a healthy environment .
#Text=It IS possible to decrease pollution without government digging deeper into OUR pockets .
#Text=The hype around global warming has cooled .
#Text=People recognise that a healthy environment can be worked on by dealing with the controllable causes of pollution .
#Text=We dump many toxic chemicals into our atmosphere not just the naturally occurring ones such as Carbon Dioxide and Water .
#Text=We can and must start controlling these toxic chemicals .
#Text=We must do the same for our lakes and environment .
#Text=Reducing the pollution we can control is environmentally friendly .
#Text=It may not be as glamourous as a global movement but it is much more effective .
#Text=We see a continued deterioration of our infrastructure .
#Text=There is no need for government to borrow money from the major banks , basically renting the money supply , to improve infrastructure .
#Text=The government is entitled to create money .

#Text=By putting this money is circulation for the purpose of improving our infrastructure and charging municipalities no interest , we are not piling further debt on the backs of our children and grandchildren .
#Text=As the money is repaid it is withdrawn from circulation thus making it noninflationary .
#Text=This was done after WW2 , when the return of 2 million soldiers seeking employment threatened our economy .
#Text=This launched the biggest building boom in Canadian history and Canada was left with healthy infrastructure .
